author: Special Correspondent
text:
The screw of a nose stud, which accidentally entered the left lung of a 78-year-old woman, has been removed using Bronchoscope at Velammal Medical College and Research Institute here by a team of doctors, led by Prem Ananth, consultant pulmonologist and bronchoscopist.

The woman came to the hospital with complaints of sudden onset of cough and difficulty in breathing. An x-ray revealed the presence of a metallic object in the left lung.

Missing

Relatives of the patient informed doctors that they had tried to remove the nose stud in the morning but could get only the stud and the screw was missing.

As the patient’s condition continued to deteriorate, it was planned to remove the foreign body through Bronchoscopy.

According to a press release, lodging of foreign body through aspiration was common among children but in the case of this patient the screw was lodged in the lower part of the left lung and hence difficult to be removed.

Hour-long procedure

Forceps were inserted through the Bronchoscope and the gold screw was removed after an hour’s procedure.

After this, the patient’s breathing became normal. Because of the advanced technique, the patient was saved from further complications and a major thoracic surgery, the statement claimed.
title: Screw of nose stud removed from lung
